results.title: The Studio
results.creator_credit: Coast Community Colleges, KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.), CBS, Holt, Rinehart and Winston and Sandra Ostertag
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
Explains how the studio setting allows the photographer maximum control of all the elements of the photograph. Jerry Abramowits, a “product photographer”, shows the photographer’s responsibilities in a typical advertising assignment, while Sandi Fellman discusses the world of fashion photography.

results.title: The Students (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, Roger Owen and Anthony Cash
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Teaching Adults”
This program looks briefly at the “consumers” of voluntary adult education. It stresses the variety of courses they pursue and especially their own diversity. An adult class is not homogeneous, there are varieties in age, educational background, experience and social class. In many situations (notably craft classes) this tends to lead to individual teaching (which can be uneconomical in terms of the use of a teacher’s time).

results.title: The Student prince
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Joe Pasternak and Richard Thorpe
results.brief_description: Edmund Purdom and Ann Bltyh star in this romantic musical set to the music of Sigmund Romberg. Prince Karl is in love, but not with the princess he is supposed to wed in a state-arranged marriage. The object of his affections is a mere Heildberg barmaid. Mario Lanza provided the singing for the film.

results.title: The Structure of protein
results.creator_credit: De La Cheura Films, Unilever Films, George Seager and John Armstrong
results.brief_description: Describes the composition of an amino acid and shows how these acids form polypeptide chains of which proteins are composed. Briefly discusses the techniques used to determine the precise structure of a protein.

results.title: The Stronger
results.brief_description: Shot in New York’s Central park, this classic one-act play, although written in 1912 in Sweden, proves to be astonishingly timely in the way it deals with woman’s struggle against the loss of self and her need for an independent life while remaining a partner in marriage. Two actresses, one a wife and a mother, the other living along, meet in a cafe. The wife talks, the other is silent. The wife faces the truth; the silent woman is her husband’s mistress. The agony of confrontation as well as the relief that follows is shared between them; the battle is over and it becomes irrelevant who is stronger. The two women have come to a deeper knowledge of self through each other. Sisterhood is born. Based on the play by August Strindberg. Starring Viveca Linfors.

results.title: The Stress mess
results.creator_credit: Barr Films, Ron Underwood and Mark Chodzko
results.brief_description: This humorous yet hard hitting film follows the Wilson family - Fred, Stacey and their college student daughter, Karen - through a typical stress filled day. The program teaches the importance of setting priorities, delegating tasks, learning to say “No”, and learning how to relax.

results.title: The Streets of Saigon
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly and Michael Rubbo
results.brief_description: This is a “social study” in the true sense, filmed in the streets of Saigon while the Vietnamese war was still going strong. Life went on fairly normally except for the noticeable presence of the military, and the number of children, orphaned, homeless, thrown on their own resources to make a living in the streets. It is these children who are in the forefront of the film, along with some American volunteers who tried to help them. Includes the work of Stephen Erhart with the children.
